title: Boy, 17, ‘tried to kill mother of his child to prove love for new partner’
text:
Jurors at Manchester Crown Court were told the plot ‘would be unbelievable but for the fact that it actually happened’ (Picture: PA)

A 17-year-old boy tried to kill the mother of his child in a ‘bizarre’ bid to prove he loved his new partner, a court heard.

The boy is said to have been egged on by his girlfriend, also 17, in a plot Manchester Crown Court heard ‘would be unbelievable but for the fact that it actually happened’.

He went to visit his ex, who he had been seeing behind her back, and raped her before telling her he ‘had to kill her’.

Jurors heard the youth behaved in a ‘bizarre’ way throughout the attack and asked her whether she would kill herself for him or agree to fake her own death.

Despite going along with the suggestion and applying makeup to her neck to make it look like she had been strangled, the boy stabbed her in the head, face, neck and back, the court heard.

Advertisement

Advertisement

It was simply a ‘matter of good fortune’ that she was not killed, it was claimed.

The boy denies rape and attempted murder.

His new girlfriend sat alongside him in the dock accused of intentionally encouraging or assisting him to commit an offence after allegedly waiting outside and sending more than 50 texts urging him on.

Prosecutor Alaric Bassano told jurors: ‘What I am about to describe sounds unbelievable, indeed it would be unbelievable but for the fact that it actually happened.’

He said the new girlfriend was ‘incensed’ and ‘felt humiliated’ after finding out the boy had cheated with his former partner.

‘She lambasted him, threatened to end the relationship and told him he would have to work hard to win back her affections,’ Mr Bassano continued.

Jurors heard the boy ‘had no grievance’ with his victim, who ‘had done him no harm’.

‘He acted not out of spite, anger, jealousy or resentment towards her,’ the prosecutor said.

‘Rather, he acted simply to find favour and maintain romance with his girlfriend.’

As he left he allegedly messaged her to say ‘I did it to prove I love you…there was no other way to keep you’, to which she was said to have replied: ‘I know there wasn’t…I’m gonna protect you at all costs.’

Advertisement

The court was told she bought Dettol wipes for her beau to wipe the knife with and instructed him to record the attack, saying: ‘Vid it then delete it when I see it please.’

Jurors were told she is expected to say she thought the boy was just going to end the relationship with his ex, and that’s what she wanted him to record.

The trial continues.

description: The boy went to visit his ex, who he had previously been seeing behind her back, where he raped her then told her he ‘had to kill her’.
